</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Covid-19 update: </strong></span><span>The global death toll from the coronavirus topped 2 million. The CDC </span><span><a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/health/health-news/cdc-says-u-k-coronavirus-variant-could-become-predominant-strain-n1254392?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">warned</a></span><span> that a highly contagious UK variant could become the predominant strain in the US by March. <span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Markets: </strong></span><span>You might have expected investors to rejoice following Biden’s speech laying out a $1.9 trillion stimulus plan. But other headwinds, including disappointing December retail sales and a dragging energy sector, </span><span><a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-stocks/wall-street-closes-lower-as-banks-energy-shares-tumble-idUSKBN29K1BY?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">got in the way</a></span><span> of celebrations.</span>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EARNINGS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/15/banks-beat-earnings-express-optimism-2021?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Banks Channel Their Inner Annie
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Banker walking out of a door leaving an umbrella behind" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNzQ5L2NsZWFyX3NraWVzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Banking titans Citigroup, JPMorgan, and Wells Fargo all <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/15/business/jp-morgan-citigroup-wells-fargo-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported earnings</a> yesterday and, like Jack Sparrow escaping from the East India Trading company, it went surprisingly well. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>JPMorgan and Citi solidly beat analyst expectations, and Wells Fargo grew quarterly profits by 5%. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> 2020 was a weird year for banks. The home-buying boom led to a rush of <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/mortgage-originations-are-on-pace-for-best-year-ever-11607596201?mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mortgage originations</a>, which are cash cows for the banks that back them. And a crop of mega-successful IPOs like DoorDash and Airbnb helped boost underwriting revenue.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>But banks also set aside record amounts for rainy day funds over the course of the year in case a deluge of loan defaults rolled in from coronavirus-battered businesses.  </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The deluge never came</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thanks to economic stimulus from Congress and lots of help from the Federal Reserve, defaults were kept relatively <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/15/jpmorgan-earnings-q4-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">in check</a>. Now, given the arrival of vaccines and Biden’s plans for more aid, banks are starting to stow their umbrellas. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>JPMorgan and Citi both shaved down their piles of reserve cash, freeing up $2.9 billion and $1.5 billion, respectively.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Still, the general attitude on Wall Street is walk-before-run. “Our credit reserves of over $30 billion continue to reflect significant near-term economic uncertainty,” JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/15/jpmorgan-earnings-q4-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> in a statement.   </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wells Fargo and Citi, meanwhile, are still trying to clean up some unforced errors. Wells Fargo paid out another $321 million in customer refunds in Q4 as it tries to put the fake accounts scandal that broke over <a href="https://edition.cnn.com/2021/01/15/investing/wells-fargo-bank-earnings-scandal/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">four years ago</a> in the rearview mirror. Citi is also retooling its internal risk controls after accidentally sending a group of lenders almost $900 million in August 2020.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Banks are feeling especially motivated to get back on track in 2021; the Fed has given the greenlight for the industry to restart stock buybacks in the first quarter. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RECAP
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/15/stories-may-missed-week?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
ICYMI
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Blue Origin launch" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNzM2L2JsdWVfb3JpZ2luX2xhdW5jaC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Blue Origin</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Think of this as the Director’s Cut of Morning Brew—all the most interesting news stories from the week that never found a home in the newsletter.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The space race is on: </strong>Blue Origin, Jeff Bezos’s space company, completed its <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2021/01/15/blue-origins-first-space-mission-2021?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">first mission of the year</a> Thursday to test out a new capsule and booster. The next step to launching a commercial space tourism service? A crewed flight by early April, <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/14/jeff-bezos-blue-origin-aims-to-fly-people-on-new-shepard-by-april.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CNBC reports</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The Yang Gang is back: </strong>Andrew Yang, entrepreneur and former Democratic presidential candidate, formally <a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/andrew-yang-nyc-mayoral-campaign-basic-income-proposal-174901072.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> his bid to become mayor of NYC on Thursday. It’s no surprise to anyone who’s followed Yang that his platform includes the “largest basic income program in the history of the country.” But Yang also wants to bring <a href="https://twitter.com/TaylorLorenz/status/1349539337973727233?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">TikTok Hype Houses</a> to the Big Apple. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Mealworms are on the menu: </strong>For those of you aching to snack on <em>Tenebrio molitor </em>larvae, we have some good news—the EU’s food safety agency found that the yellow mealworm is safe for human consumption, a ruling that could unleash mass production of mealworm smoothies, pasta, burgers, and more, <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2021/jan/13/yellow-mealworm-safe-for-humans-to-eat-says-eu-food-safety-agency?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes the Guardian</a>. High in protein and low on carbon emissions...what’s not to like? </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENTREPRENEURS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/15/marc-lore-leaves-walmart-eyes-building-city-future?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Keep Your Eye on Marc Lore
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Marc Lore" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNzUxL21hcmNfbG9yZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mike Pont/Getty Images for AWXII</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Because this guy’s leaving his current job, and he’s always up to something interesting.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The job he’s leaving: </strong>US e-commerce boss for Walmart. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Lore started Jet.com, the online shopping startup that was bought by Walmart for $3.3 billion just 15 months after Jet was founded. Walmart has since folded the Jet.com brand in order to streamline its e-commerce operations under the Walmart.com banner. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s next? </strong>“I’m writing a book. I’m creating a reality TV show. I’m going to probably buy a sports team…” Lore <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/walmart-e-commerce-boss-marc-lore-to-leave-11610724954?mod=hp_lista_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the WSJ</a>. If you think he’s joking, then you haven’t heard his other post-Walmart goal.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Lore is </span><span><a href="https://www.vox.com/recode/2021/1/15/22232033/marc-lore-walmart-leaving-jet-city-future-capitalism?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">embarking</a></span><span> on a multi-decade project to build a futuristic city with an innovative economic framework. “It’s the thing I’m most passionate about,” Lore explained to Recode.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Before you call Lore crazy, you should know he’s what business people call a “serial entrepreneur.” Several years before he sold Jet.com to Walmart, he sold Quidsi, the parent of Diapers.com, to Amazon for $550 million. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://www.bose.com/en_us/products/wellness/noise_masking_sleepbuds/noise-masking-sleepbuds-ii.html?mc=25_CE_QE_GM_00_M2_MB116#v=noise_masking_sleepbuds_ii_white" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bose Sleepbuds™ II</a> are <strong style="color:#000">tiny, comfortable earbuds </strong>that sooth you with <strong style="color:#000">relaxing sounds all night long</strong>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">They’re helping us sleep soundly; they’re also putting sleep sheep out of work.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sleep sheep are a specific breed of sheep who love to appear in the minds of people who can’t fall asleep. But with <a href="https://www.bose.com/en_us/products/wellness/noise_masking_sleepbuds/noise-masking-sleepbuds-ii.html?mc=25_CE_QE_GM_00_M2_MB116#v=noise_masking_sleepbuds_ii_white" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bose Sleepbuds™ II</a>, sleep sheep are obsolete! <p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Anyone who’s got a pair of Sleepbuds? Safe to say their struggles to fall asleep—and stay asleep—are over. Baaaaaaad luck, sleep sheep.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
DATING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/15/bumble-reveals-financials-ahead-ipo?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Bumble Prepares to Go Public
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Bumble" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNzUzL2J1bWJsZS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Jaap Arriens/NurPhoto via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Ahead of its <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-bumble-ipo/dating-app-bumble-reveals-steady-revenue-growth-losses-in-ipo-filing-idUSKBN29K23Y?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">upcoming public offering</a>, dating app Bumble yesterday dropped its S-1 form. It’s like a dating profile, but companies hold up important financial metrics instead of big fish. Here’s the scoop on Bumble:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The company had 42 million monthly active users in Q3.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It generated $377 million in revenue in the year through September, but posted an $84 million loss during that same period. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Bumble’s claim to fame: Giving women <em>pollice verso</em>
</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even if both users swipe right, only women are allowed to make the first move. If they don’t send a message within 24 hours, the match expires. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This women-first approach to mobile dating is reflected in Bumble’s leadership: Founder Whitney Wolfe Herd will become one of the <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/01/15/tech/bumble-ipo-paperwork/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">youngest female tech CEOs</a> to take a company public. Bumble’s corporate board is also made up of <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2021/01/15/bumble-files-to-go-public/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more than 70%</a> women.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> Among the thousands of publicly traded companies in the US, only about 20 women have founded and led their business through to an IPO, according to a <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/female-entrepreneurs-face-obstacles-taking-companies-public-2020-12?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recent analysis</a> by Business Insider.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Because we know you’re wondering...</strong>here’s where <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pollice_verso?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>pollice verso</em></a> comes from.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ADVERTISING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/01/15/youre-going-see-lots-insurance-ads-featuring-nfl-quarterbacks-throughout-playoffs?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
No Disrespect to Chatty Geckos...
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But NFL quarterbacks are the <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/15/tv-ads-for-insurance-companies-featuring-nfl-quarterbacks-outperform-other-ads.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">gold standard</a> when it comes to insurance spokespeople. Ahead of this weekend’s playoff football games, advertising metrics firm EDO told CNBC that insurance ads featuring a QB who is playing in the game fans are watching “perform two–three times better” than other ads aired in that game.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The outperformers</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Sunday, Browns QB and Progressive Insurance spokesperson Baker Mayfield is taking on Kansas City QB and State Farm rep Patrick Mahomes in their second-round playoff matchup. Ahead of the showdown, Victoria Bussert, the director of musical theatre at Baldwin-Wallace University, <a href="https://www.cleveland.com/tribe/2021/01/baker-mayfield-patrick-mahomes-rival-insurance-pitchmen-will-duel-on-the-field-but-whos-the-better-actor-right-now.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">critiqued</a> each superstar’s acting chops for Cleveland.com.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">She roasted Mahomes:</strong></span><span> “He uses unnatural physical gestures that you wouldn’t really use when you’re talking to try and make him look natural.” </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">But stans Mayfield: </strong></span><span>“He has so much presence, physically, and he’s actually a brilliant comedian.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Progressive’s CMO Jeff Charney agrees with Bussert and plans to hand Baker lots of airtime. “We’re going to run heavy this week,” he told CNBC.  </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TAXES
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/tax-guide?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Tax illustration" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNjc0L3RheF9pbGx1c3RyYXRpb24ucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mark Wang</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>This article is part of our <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/tax-guide?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ongoing series</a> on taxes and the gig economy.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">One of the major challenges of filing taxes as a gig economy worker is figuring out which expenses to deduct.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Deductions are important because you can use them to lower your tax liability with the IRS. Now, deductions can be confusing for the typical worker. But for the self-employed, for whom the line between the “personal” and the “business” is blurry, they can be tougher to crack than a 12-sided Rubik's Cube.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To show the <a href="https://taxfoundation.org/gig-economy-workers/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">complexities</a> of deductions, let’s discuss two examples: the Uber driver and the Airbnb host. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The Uber driver uses the same car to drive their kids to soccer practice and to drive a client to the airport. The driver </span><span><em>can </em></span><span>claim auto expenses associated with working for Uber as a deduction on their tax form, but it can be complicated/tedious to track.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Airbnb host runs into a similar issue, because they may use their house for both personal use and as a rental property.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>There is one, new-ish deduction that most gig economy workers can take advantage of—the provision on so-called “pass-through” businesses included in the 2017 tax bill. It allows for a 20% deduction of qualified business income.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Optional homework...</strong>read this list on <a href="https://www.investopedia.com/articles/tax/09/self-employed-tax-deductions.asp?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">15 tax deductions and benefits</a> for the self-employed.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BREW'S BETS
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">One click to double down</strong>. That’s all it takes to get access to <a href="https://www.fool.com/mms/mark/a-sa-dd-3?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=contentmarketing&utm_campaign=sar-doubledown3&aid=9431&paid=9431&waid=9431&source=esamnbwdg0210137&psource=esamnbwdg0210137&wsource=esamnbwdg0210137" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">The Motley Fool’s</a> newest Double Down stocks (past examples include Netflix, Amazon, and Apple). And President-elect Joe Biden introduced his plan to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-biden/biden-unveils-plan-to-speed-u-s-covid-19-vaccine-rollout-idUSKBN29K0NF?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espeed up\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the vaccination rollout.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarkets: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYou might have expected investors to rejoice following Biden’s speech laying out a $1.9 trillion stimulus plan. style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egot in the way\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of Annie\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Banker walking out of a door leaving an umbrella behind\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBanking titans Citigroup, JPMorgan, and Wells Fargo all \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/01/15/business/jp-morgan-citigroup-wells-fargo-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereported earnings\u003c/a\u003e yesterday and, like Jack Sparrow escaping from the East India Trading company, it went surprisingly well. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eJPMorgan and Citi solidly beat analyst expectations, and Wells Fargo grew quarterly profits by 5%. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e 2020 was a weird year for banks. The home-buying boom led to a rush of \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/mortgage-originations-are-on-pace-for-best-year-ever-11607596201?mod=article_inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emortgage originations\u003c/a\u003e, which are cash cows for the banks that back them. And a crop of mega-successful IPOs like DoorDash and Airbnb helped boost underwriting revenue.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBut banks also set aside record amounts for rainy day funds over the course of the year in case a deluge of loan defaults rolled in from coronavirus-battered businesses.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe deluge never came\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThanks to economic stimulus from Congress and lots of help from the Federal Reserve, defaults were kept relatively \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/15/jpmorgan-earnings-q4-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ein check\u003c/a\u003e. Now, given the arrival of vaccines and Biden’s plans for more aid, banks are starting to stow their umbrellas. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eJPMorgan and Citi both shaved down their piles of reserve cash, freeing up $2.9 billion and $1.5 billion, respectively.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eStill, the general attitude on Wall Street is walk-before-run. “Our credit reserves of over $30 billion continue to reflect significant near-term economic uncertainty,” JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/15/jpmorgan-earnings-q4-2020.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e in a statement.   \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWells Fargo and Citi, meanwhile, are still trying to clean up some unforced errors. Wells Fargo paid out another $321 million in customer refunds in Q4 as it tries to put the fake accounts scandal that broke over \u003ca href=\"https://edition.cnn.com/2021/01/15/investing/wells-fargo-bank-earnings-scandal/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efour years ago\u003c/a\u003e in the rearview mirror. Citi is also retooling its internal risk controls after accidentally sending a group of lenders almost $900 million in August 2020.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eBanks are feeling especially motivated to get back on track in 2021; the Fed has given the greenlight for the industry to restart stock buybacks in the first quarter. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2021%2F01%2F15%2Fbanks-beat-earnings-express-optimism-2021\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zNzM2L2JsdWVfb3JpZ2luX2xhdW5jaC5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eBlue Origin\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThink of this as the Director’s Cut of Morning Brew—all the most interesting news stories from the week that never found a home in the newsletter.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe space race is on: \u003c/strong\u003eBlue Origin, Jeff Bezos’s space company, completed its \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2021/01/15/blue-origins-first-space-mission-2021?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efirst mission of the year\u003c/a\u003e Thursday to test out a new capsule and booster. The next step to launching a commercial space tourism service? A crewed flight by early April, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/01/14/jeff-bezos-blue-origin-aims-to-fly-people-on-new-shepard-by-april.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCNBC reports\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe Yang Gang is back: \u003c/strong\u003eAndrew Yang, entrepreneur and former Democratic presidential candidate, formally \u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/andrew-yang-nyc-mayoral-campaign-basic-income-proposal-174901072.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e his bid to become mayor of NYC on Thursday. It’s no surprise to anyone who’s followed Yang that his platform includes the “largest basic income program in the history of the country.” But Yang also wants to bring \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/TaylorLorenz/status/1349539337973727233?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eTikTok Hype Houses\u003c/a\u003e to the Big Apple. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMealworms are on the menu: \u003c/strong\u003eFor those of you aching to snack on \u003cem\u003eTenebrio molitor \u003c/em\u003elarvae, we have some good news—the EU’s food safety agency found that the yellow mealworm is safe for human consumption, a ruling that could unleash mass production of mealworm smoothies, pasta, burgers, and more, \u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2021/jan/13/yellow-mealworm-safe-for-humans-to-eat-says-eu-food-safety-agency?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites the Guardian\u003c/a\u003e. style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBecause this guy’s leaving his current job, and he’s always up to something interesting.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe job he’s leaving: \u003c/strong\u003eUS e-commerce boss for Walmart. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eLore started Jet.com, the online shopping startup that was bought by Walmart for $3.3 billion just 15 months after Jet was founded. Walmart has since folded the Jet.com brand in order to streamline its e-commerce operations under the Walmart.com banner. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s next? \u003c/strong\u003e“I’m writing a book. I’m creating a reality TV show. I’m going to probably buy a sports team…” Lore \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/walmart-e-commerce-boss-marc-lore-to-leave-11610724954?mod=hp_lista_pos2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e. If you think he’s joking, then you haven’t heard his other post-Walmart goal.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eLore is \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/recode/2021/1/15/22232033/marc-lore-walmart-leaving-jet-city-future-capitalism?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eembarking\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e on a multi-decade project to build a futuristic city with an innovative economic framework. “It’s the thing I’m most passionate about,” Lore explained to Recode.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eBefore you call Lore crazy, you should know he’s what business people call a “serial entrepreneur.” Several years before he sold Jet.com to Walmart, he sold Quidsi, the parent of Diapers.com, to Amazon for $550 million. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS href=\"https://www.cleveland.com/tribe/2021/01/baker-mayfield-patrick-mahomes-rival-insurance-pitchmen-will-duel-on-the-field-but-whos-the-better-actor-right-now.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" Mahomes:\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e “He uses unnatural physical gestures that you wouldn’t really use when you’re talking to try and make him look natural.” \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eongoing series\u003c/a\u003e on taxes and the gig economy.\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOne of the major challenges of filing taxes as a gig economy worker is figuring out which expenses to deduct.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDeductions are important because you can use them to lower your tax liability with the IRS. Now, deductions can be confusing for the typical worker. But for the self-employed, for whom the line between the “personal” and the “business” is blurry, they can be tougher to crack than a 12-sided Rubik's Cube.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo show the \u003ca href=\"https://taxfoundation.org/gig-economy-workers/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecomplexities\u003c/a\u003e of deductions, let’s discuss two examples: the Uber driver and the Airbnb host. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe Uber driver uses the same car to drive their kids to soccer practice and to drive a client to the airport. The driver \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ecan \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eclaim auto expenses associated with working for Uber as a deduction on their tax form, but it can be complicated/tedious to track.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe Airbnb host runs into a similar issue, because they may use their house for both personal use and as a rental property.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eThere is one, new-ish deduction that most gig economy workers can take advantage of—the provision on so-called “pass-through” businesses included in the 2017 tax bill. It allows for a 20% deduction of qualified business income.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Optional homework...\u003c/strong\u003eread this list on \u003ca href=\"https://www.investopedia.com/articles/tax/09/self-employed-tax-deductions.asp?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e15 tax deductions and benefits\u003c/a\u003e for the self-employed.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c/th\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e\u003c!
